snippet: Employers added 155,000 jobs in December, about apace with job growth over the last year, the Labor Department reported on Friday. The unemployment rate was 7.8 percent.
abstract: Labor Department reports that unemployment held steady at 7.8 percent in December, as American employers added 155,000 jobs; backlog of 12.2 million jobless workers persists, underscoring challenges facing Washington politicians as they continue to wrestle over how to address the budget deficit.
lead_paragraph: Employers added 155,000 jobs in December, about apace with job growth over the last year, the Labor Department reported on Friday. The unemployment rate was 7.8 percent.

headline.seo: 155,000 Jobs Added in December; Jobless Rate Is Steady at 7.8%
headline.main: Job Creation Is Still Steady Despite Worry
headline.print_headline: Job Creation Is Still Steady Despite Worry
